title: Expanding Educational Opportunity Through School Choice

enrichment.summary: This executive order aims to provide emergency learning scholarships to families whose children lack access to in-person learning due to the COVID-19 pandemic. It allows certain federal funds to be used to support alternatives like private school tuition, homeschooling, special education services, and tutoring to ensure children can continue their education safely.
potential_concerns: The expansion of emergency learning scholarships may divert funding and students away from public schools, adversely impacting public-school communities' resources and quality of education (k-12-education-policy, public-school-communities).

Low-income families might face challenges navigating or accessing the new scholarship opportunities due to administrative barriers, potentially limiting the order's intended benefit to disadvantaged groups (school-choice-vouchers, low-income-individuals-families).

Children with special needs may not uniformly benefit from voucher-supported private or alternative education options if those services lack the capacity or expertise to provide adequate special education and related therapies (special-education-students-families, k-12-education-policy).

Homeschool and private-school families might face increased demand and strain as more students seek alternatives to public in-person learning, potentially stressing available resources or quality within those communities (homeschool-families, private-school-communities).
